SourceProxy.label: Parallel NetCDF POP reader
SourceProxy.name: PNetCDFPOPReader

Documentation.long_help: Reads rectilinear grid data from a NetCDF POP file in parallel.
Documentation.short_help: Read rectilinear grid data from a NetCDF file in the POP format in parallel.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The reader reads regular rectilinear grid (image/volume) data from a NetCDF file. Only a subset of the processes actually read the file and these processes communicate the data to other processes.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of files to be read by the reader.

SourceProxy.label: Ghost Cells Generator
SourceProxy.name: GhostCellsGenerator

Documentation.long_help: Generate ghost cells for unstructured grids.
Documentation.short_help: Generate ghost cells for unstructured grids.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The GhostCellGenerator operates on unstructured grids only. This filter does not redistribute the input data, it only generates ghost cells at processor boundaries by fetching topological and geometrical information of those cells on neighbor ranks. The filter can take advantage of global point ids if they are available - if so it will perform faster, otherwise point coordinates will be exchanged and processed.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the ghost cells generator.

IntVectorProperty.name: BuildIfRequired
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify if the filter must generate the ghost cells only if required by the pipeline downstream. To force at least a fixed level of ghosts, this must be set to 0 (unchecked).

IntVectorProperty.name: MinimumNumberOfGhostLevels
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When **BuildIfRequired** if off, use this to specify the minimum number of ghost cells to request. The filter may request more ghost levels than indicated if a downstream filter asked for more ghost levels.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseGlobalIds
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify if the filter must take benefit of global point ids if they exist or if point coordinates should be used instead.

StringVectorProperty.name: GlobalPointIdsArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property provides the name for the input array containing the global point ids if the GlobalIds array of the point data if not set. Default is GlobalNodeIds.
